messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I’m enabling location services on your device, but that call just confirms it’s already on.  
What should happen next is that the system (or your app) retrieve your current latitude/longitude and then I can translate that into an address. If you aren’t receiving an automatic location prompt, can you either:

- grant the browser/app location permission, or  
- tell me a latitude/longitude pair yourself?

Once I have valid coordinates, I’ll look up your exact address.
I'm not sure how to find my latitude/longitude.

Here are a few quick ways to find your current latitude/longitude:

• On a smartphone
  – iPhone: Open the Maps app, tap the arrow icon to center on you, then tap the blue dot—your coordinates appear at the bottom.
  – Android: Open Google Maps, tap the blue dot that shows your location, and the info card lists your lat/long.

• In any web browser
  – Visit maps.google.com, click the small target/“Your location” button in the bottom right, then right-click the blue dot and choose “What’s here?” The lat/long shows in the search box or bottom card.

• Using the compass app (iPhone/Android built-ins)
  – Open the Compass app and look for the latitude/longitude shown on-screen.

Once you give me the numbers, I’ll translate them into a street address for you.
Great! Just send me the latitude and longitude you obtained, and I’ll convert them into a street address for you.
